Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Acceptances Denominated In Foreign Currency Amount
Of the total amount reported for "acceptances" identify the component that is denominated in other than Australian dollars.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Acceptances Total Amount

* The ADI expects most acceptances to be presented before being reimbursed by the customers. These bills of exchange are not held as part of the ADI's asset portfolio. Acceptances are accounted for and disclosed as a liability with a corresponding contra asset. The contra asset is recognised to reflect the ADI's claim against each drawer of the bills of exchange. * Bills of exchange that have been accepted and held in an ADI's asset portfolio should be excluded from this item. * Netting is allowed in accordance with the requirements specified in the Australian accounting standards (i.e. only if there is a legal right to set off and there is an intention to settle on a net basis, or realise the assets and settle the liability simultaneously).
Acceptances comprise undertakings by an ADI to pay bills of exchange drawn on customers.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities At Amortised Cost Amount
For interpretation/definition of this item refer to the Australian Accounting Standards, as an example, see provided reference
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Australian ADI Operations Total Amount Due From Non Residents Excluding Intra Company Transactions Denominated In Foreign Currency Amount

This data item includes all on-balance sheet liabilities booked with non-resident counterparties that are recorded in the Australian books only and are denominated in other than Australian dollars. Exclude: * transactions with offshore operations.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Australian ADI Operations Total Amount Due From Non Residents Excluding Intra Company Transactions Deposit Liabilities Amount
This data item includes all deposit liabilities booked in Australia with non-resident counterparties. Exclude: * deposit liability transactions with offshore operations.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Australian ADI Operations Total Amount Due From Non Residents Excluding Intra Company Transactions Amount
This data item includes all on-balance sheet liabilities booked with non-resident counterparties that are recorded in the Australian books only. Exclude: * transactions with offshore operations.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Australian ADI Operations Total Amounts Due From Overseas Operations Of The ADI Denominated In Foreign Currency Amount

This data item includes all on balance sheet liabilities denominated in other than Australian dollars booked with offshore operations of the licensed Australian ADI (i.e. overseas branches for locally incorporated ADIs or parent entity for Australian branches of a foreign ADI). The types of accounting entry or financial instruments that constitute this total are not required to be separately identified.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Australian ADI Operations Total Amounts Due From Overseas Operations Of The ADI Deposit Liabilities Amount

This data item includes all deposit liabilities booked in Australia with non-resident counterparties. Exclude: * deposit liability transactions with non-resident counterparties other than offshore operations.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Australian ADI Operations Total Amounts Due From Overseas Operations Of The ADI Amount

This data item includes all on balance sheet liabilities booked with offshore operations of the licensed Australian ADI (i.e. overseas branches for locally incorporated ADIs or parent entity for Australian branches of a foreign ADI). The types of accounting entry or financial instruments that constitute this total are not required to be separately identified.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Borrowings Including Off Balance Sheet Borrowings Other Total Amount
This is the amount of the detailed line items within the balancing item within the list in which it is being used
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Borrowings Including Off Balance Sheet Borrowings Other Amount
This is the amount of the detailed line items within the balancing item within the list in which it is being used
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Borrowings Including Off Balance Sheet Borrowings Other Description
This is the description of the detailed line items within the balancing item within the list in which it is being used
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Borrowings Including Off Balance Sheet Borrowings Total Amount

Amounts to be reported in the item include but are not limited to the following: * Securities sold under agreements to repurchase. * Drawn down balance of overdraft facilities, standby lines or other forms of off- balance sheet funding; and * Short-term loans or borrowings.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Borrowings Secured Amount
Total borrowings that are secured against the assets of the reporting entity, regardless of their expected repayment term (i.e. total of both current and non current borrowings)
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Borrowings Total Amount
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Claims Arising From Repos And Stock Borrowing Amount

Include: Securities sold under agreements to repurchase, stock lending These transactions are to be recorded in accordance with AASB 139. Where the transferee of the stock effectively receives a lenders rate of return (i.e. the underlying risks and rewards of ownership of the underlying stock is not effectively transferred), these transactions are to be accounted for as collateralised lending activities. Securities sold under agreements to repurchase represents the payable due to counterparties with whom the stock has been lent and from whom cash has been lodged. Under this method of accounting the RFC's physical stock positions recorded on the balance sheet in either Trading Securities or Investment Securities sections is not affected.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Current Available For Sale Amount
For interpretation/definition of this item refer to the Australian Accounting Standards, as an example, see provided reference
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Current Borrowings Secured Amount
Total borrowings that are secured against the assets of the reporting entity, due to be repaid within the next 12 months.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Current Borrowings Amount

The total of: * Securities sold under agreements to repurchase, representing the payable due to counterparties with whom the stock has been lent and from whom cash has been lodged. These transactions are to be recorded consistently with AASB 139. Where the transferee of the stock effectively receives a lenders rate of return (i.e. the underlying risks and rewards of ownership of the underlying stock is not effectively transferred), these transactions are to be accounted for as collateralised lending activities (treating stock lending as on balance sheet exposures). Under this method of accounting the banks physical stock positions recorded on the balance sheet in either Trading Securities or Investment Securities sections is not affected.
* Commercial paper or promissory notes - short-term debt securities issued with a residual term to maturity of 12 months or less.
* Short term loans. A loan is considered to be short term if its residual term to maturity is of 12 months or less.
* All other debt securities issued with a residual term to maturity of 12 months or less.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Current Debt Securities Amount

"Report all borrowings by the reporting entity in the form of commercial paper, promissory notes and other forms of securities issued by the insurer. Include all notes/securities such as commercial paper or promissory notes issued with a residual term to maturity of more than 12 months."
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Current Deferred Income Amount
For interpretation/definition of this item refer to the Australian Accounting Standards, as an example, see provided reference
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Current Deficit Defined Benefit Superannuation Fund Amount

Disclose the value of any deficit in a defined benefit superannuation fund of which the insurer is an employer-sponsor, consistent with the classification and measurement basis used in AASB 119 'Employee Benefits', that represents amounts due within 12 months
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Current Defined Benefit Liability Or Asset Amount
For interpretation/definition of this item refer to the Australian Accounting Standards, as an example, see provided reference
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Current Derivative Financial Instruments At Cost Amount

Include all current derivatives consistent with the classification and measurement basis used for derivatives by institutions in accordance with AASB 7, AASB 132 and AASB 139. Derivative financial instruments should be reported at their net fair value when unfavourable to the reporting entity. Fair values are obtained from quoted market prices, discount cash flow models and options pricing models.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Current Derivative Financial Instruments Total Amount

Include all current derivatives at cost (where fair value cannot be reliably determined) consistent with the classification and measurement basis used for derivatives by institutions in accordance with AASB 7, AASB 132 and AASB 139 where the value is negative.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Current Designated At Amortised Cost Amount
For interpretation/definition of this item refer to the Australian Accounting Standards, as an example, see provided reference
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Current Designated At Fair Value Through Profit Or Loss Classified As Held For Trading Amount
For interpretation/definition of this item refer to the Australian Accounting Standards, as an example, see provided reference
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Current Designated At Fair Value Through Profit Or Loss Derivatives Amount

Include all current derivatives consistent with the classification and measurement basis used for derivatives by institutions in accordance with AASB 7, AASB 132 and AASB 139 where the value is negative.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Current Designated At Fair Value Through Profit Or Loss Upon Initial Recognition Amount
For interpretation/definition of this item refer to the Australian Accounting Standards, as an example, see provided reference
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Current Designated At Fair Value Through Profit Or Loss Amount
For interpretation/definition of this item refer to the Australian Accounting Standards, as an example, see provided reference
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Current Finance Lease Amount
Report the value of finance lease liability due and payable within 12 months.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Current Liabilities Other Than Liabilities Or Disposal Groups Classified As Held For Sale Amount
For interpretation/definition of this item refer to the Australian Accounting Standards, as an example, see provided reference
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Current Total Amount
For interpretation/definition of this item refer to the Australian Accounting Standards, as an example, see provided reference
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Current Unvested Policyholder Benefits Amount
For interpretation/definition of this item refer to the Australian Accounting Standards, as an example, see provided reference
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Deferred Fee Income Amount
Deferred fee income should be reported in this line item and deducted from Total gross loans and advances.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Deferred Tax Amount
For interpretation/definition of this item refer to the Australian Accounting Standards, as an example, see provided reference
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Defined Benefit Liability Or Asset Total Amount
For interpretation/definition of this item refer to the Australian Accounting Standards, as an example, see provided reference
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Derivative Financial Instruments Total Amount

Include all trading and non trading derivatives consistent with the classification and measurement basis used for derivatives by institutions in accordance with AASB 132, AASB 7 and AASB 139. Derivative financial instruments should be reported at their net fair value in this item when unfavorable to the reporting entity. Fair values are obtained from quoted market prices, discount cash flow models and options pricing models.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Derivatives Banking Book Amount

Include all banking book derivatives entered into after adoption of IFRS consistent with the classification and measurement basis used for derivatives by institutions in accordance with AASB 132, AASB 7 and AASB 139. Derivative financial instruments in existence prior to adoption of IFRS are to be reported in accordance with AASB 1.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Derivatives Trading Book Amount

Include all trading book derivatives entered into after adoption of IFRS consistent with the classification and measurement basis used for derivatives by institutions in accordance with AASB 132, AASB 7 and AASB 139. Derivative financial instruments in existence prior to adoption of IFRS are to be reported in accordance with AASB 1.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Derivatives Amount

Include only derivatives that are directly held by the entity that represent trading and non trading derivatives consistent with the classification and measurement basis used for derivatives by institutions in accordance with AASB 132, AASB 7 and AASB 139. Derivative financial instruments should be reported at their net fair value in this item when unfavorable to the reporting entity ie where it represents a net loss to the superannuation entity. Fair values are obtained from quoted market prices, discount cash flow models and options pricing model.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Designated At Fair Value Through Profit Or Loss Classified As Held For Trading Amount
For interpretation/definition of this item refer to the Australian Accounting Standards, as an example, see provided reference
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Designated At Fair Value Through Profit Or Loss Derivatives Banking Amount
Banking book derivative Liabilities at fair value through profit and loss balances categorised in accordance with AASB 139.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Designated At Fair Value Through Profit Or Loss Derivatives Trading Amount
Trading book derivative Liabilities at fair value through profit and loss balances categorised in accordance with AASB 139.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Designated At Fair Value Through Profit Or Loss Other Amount

Financial Liabilities at fair value through profit and loss balances categorised in accordance with AASB 139, other than: * Banking book derivative liabilities at fair value through profit and loss * Trading book derivative liabilities at fair value through profit and loss
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Designated At Fair Value Through Profit Or Loss Total Amount
Financial Liabilities at fair value through profit and loss balances categorised in accordance with AASB 139.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Designated At Fair Value Through Profit Or Loss Upon Initial Recognition Amount
For interpretation/definition of this item refer to the Australian Accounting Standards, as an example, see provided reference
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Due To Banks Amount
Include settlement account balances due to Australian and offshore banks.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Due To Clearing Houses Total Amount
Include: * amounts due to recognised clearing houses such as the ASXCH and SFXCH in Australia. Include margin calls from stock and derivative exchanges which are payable.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Due To Financial Institutions Total Denominated In Foreign Currency Amount
Of the total amount reported for "total due to financial institutions" identify the component that is denominated in other than Australian dollars.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Due To Financial Institutions Total Amount
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Due To Merchants Amount
For SCCIs, report any amounts owed to merchants as a result of acquiring credit card transactions.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Due To Other ADIs Excluding Banks Amount
Include settlement account balances due to other ADIs.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Due To Other Financial Institutions Amount
Include settlement account balances due to other financial institutions.
Other financial institutions refer to financial institutions other than central banks and banks.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Due To Registered Financial Corporations Amount
Include settlement account balances due to RFCs.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Due To Reserve Bank of Australia Amount
Include settlement account balances due to the RBA and foreign central banks. Funds borrowed from the RBA and other central banks should also be reported in this data item.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Hybrid Securities Amount

Report the face value of all loan capital and hybrid securities that have a residual term to maturity of more than one year. Classification is to be consistent with AASB 132 and AASB 7. As a guide include: * converting preference shares; and * convertible notes.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Indirect Liabilities Amount
The reporting entity's share of the underlying liabilities of a trust
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Interest Payable Amount
Include interest accrued for but not yet paid.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Interest Receivable Other Amount

Include: * interest accrued but not yet paid and not accounted for elsewhere. Exclude: * interest added to loan and deposit accounts; and * interest accrued on securities included in their carrying value.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Items In Suspense Amount

Report suspense or unreconciled/unidentified transactions/balances that are in a liability position. A list of examples is not provided as these may vary between institutions. It is recommended that the institution's internal procedures be adopted regarding the recording and reporting of these types of balances.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Liabilities Included In Disposal Groups Classified As Held For Sale Amount
Include liabilities included in disposal groups classified as held for sale consistent with AASB 5 (paragraph 38).
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Loan Capital And Hybrid Securities Denominated In Foreign Currency Total Amount

Report the face value of all loan capital and hybrid securities denominated in other than Australian dollars that have a residual term to maturity of more than one year. Classification is to be consistent with AASB 132 and AASB 7. As a guide include: * Members withdrawable shares; * preference shares; * convertible notes; and * subordinated loans of a residual maturity of more than one year.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Loan Capital And Hybrid Securities Members Withdrawable Shares Amount

Include the value of credit union member withdrawable shares. This item should be prepared in accordance with the APRA prudential treatment and applicable Australian Accounting Standards. For prudential purposes, a credit union member share is classified as a liability and is not capital. In the event of redemption, the liability would be reduced by the issue value of shares redeemed.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Loan Capital And Hybrid Securities Total Amount

Report the face value of all loan capital and hybrid securities that have a residual term to maturity of more than one year. Classification is to be consistent with AASB 132 and AASB 7. As a guide include: * Members withdrawable shares; * preference shares; * convertible notes; and * subordinated loans of a residual maturity of more than one year.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Loan Capital Amount

Report the face value of all loan capital that has a residual term to maturity of more than one year. Classification is to be consistent with AASB 132 and AASB 7. As a guide, include subordinated loans of a residual maturity of more than one year.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Non Current Borrowings Secured Amount
Total borrowings that are secured against the assets of the reporting entity, that are not due to be repaid within the next 12 months.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Non Current Debt Securities Amount

Report all borrowings by the reporting entity in the form of commercial paper, promissory notes and other forms of securities issued by the insurer. Commercial paper or promissory notes are short-term debt securities usually issued with an original term to maturity of less than 180 days. Include all notes/securities issued with a residual term to maturity of more than 12 months. Commercial paper or promissory notes with a residual maturity greater than 12 months should be reported as "non-current liability - borrowings".
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Non Current Deferred Income Amount
For interpretation/definition of this item refer to the Australian Accounting Standards, as an example, see provided reference
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Non Current Deficit Defined Benefit Superannuation Fund Amount

Disclose the value of any deficit in any insurer employer-sponsored defined benefit superannuation fund of which the insurer is an employer-sponsor, consistent with the classification and measurement basis used in AASB 119 'Employee Benefits', that represents amounts due after 12 months.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Non Current Defined Benefit Liability Or Asset Amount
Include non-current defined benefit liabilities consistent with the classification and measurement basis used in AASB 119.
For interpretation/definition of this item refer to the Australian Accounting Standards, as an example, see provided reference
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Non Current Defined Benefits Amount
For interpretation/definition of this item refer to the Australian Accounting Standards, as an example, see provided reference
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Non Current Derivative Financial Instruments At Cost Amount

Include all Non Current derivatives consistent with the classification and measurement basis used for derivatives by institutions in accordance with AASB 7, AASB 132 and AASB 139. Derivative financial instruments should be reported at their net fair value when unfavourable to the reporting entity. Fair values are obtained from quoted market prices, discount cash flow models and options pricing models.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Non Current Derivative Financial Instruments Total Amount

Include all Non Current derivatives at cost (where fair value cannot be reliably determined) consistent with the classification and measurement basis used for derivatives by institutions in accordance with AASB 7, AASB 132 and AASB 139 where the value is negative.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Non Current Designated At Fair Value Through Profit Or Loss Derivatives Amount

Include all Non Current derivatives consistent with the classification and measurement basis used for derivatives by institutions in accordance with AASB 7, AASB 132 and AASB 139 where the value is negative.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Non Current Finance Lease Amount
Report the value of finance lease liability not due and payable within 12 months.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Non Current Total Amount
For interpretation/definition of this item refer to the Australian Accounting Standards, as an example, see provided reference
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Other Borrowings Denominated In Foreign Currency Total Amount

The total of the following borrowings denominated in other than Australian dollars: * Securities sold under agreements to repurchase, representing the payable due to counterparties with whom the stock has been lent and from whom cash has been lodged.These transactions are to be recorded consistently with AASB 139. Where the transferee of the stock effectively receives a lenders rate of return (i.e. the underlying risks and rewards of ownership of the underlying stock is not effectively transferred), these transactions are to be accounted for as collateralised lending activities (treating stock lending as on balance sheet exposures). Under this method of accounting the banks physical stock positions recorded on the balance sheet in either Trading Securities or Investment Securities sections is not affected.
* Commercial paper or promissory notes - short-term debt securities issued with a residual term to maturity of 12 months or less.
* Short term loans. A loan is considered to be short term if its residual term to maturity is of 12 months or less.
* All other debt securities issued with a residual term to maturity of 12 months or less.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Other Creditors And Other Liabilities As Defined By APRA Form ARF320 Amount

This is a balancing item, being the Total Liabilities as per accounting standards other than: * Total bonds, notes and long-term borrowings, * Total provisions, * Total income tax liability, * Total other borrowings, * Total Deposits, * Acceptances, * Total due to financial institutions, * Due to clearing houses * Total loan capital and hybrid securities * Defined benefit liabilities - Current, Non-current, * Interest payable, * Unearned interest, * Amounts payable to clients - outstanding security settlements, * Derivative financial instruments, * Securities purchased not delivered security settlements, * Liabilities included in disposal groups classified as held for sale, * Share capital repayable on demand, * Items in suspense
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Other Creditors And Other Liabilities As Defined By APRA Form ARF321 Amount

This is a balancing item, being the Total Liabilities as per accounting standards other than: * Intra-company borrowings, * Total bonds, notes and long-term borrowings, * Total provisions, * Total income tax liability, * Total other borrowings, * Total Deposits, * Acceptances, * Total due to financial institutions, * Due to clearing houses * Total loan capital and hybrid securities * Defined benefit liabilities - Current, Non-current, * Interest payable, * Unearned interest, * Amounts payable to clients - outstanding security settlements, * Derivative financial instruments, * Liabilities included in disposal groups classified as held for sale, * Share capital repayable on demand, * Items in suspense
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Other Creditors And Other Liabilities As Defined By APRA Form ARF322 And 323 Amount

This is a balancing item, being the Total Liabilities as per accounting standards other than: * Total bonds, notes and long-term borrowings, * Unvested policy holder benefits, * Life insurance policy liabilities, * General insurance outstanding claims and unearned premium, * Total provisions, * Total income tax liability, * Total other borrowings, * Total Deposits, * Acceptances, * Total due to financial institutions, * Due to clearing houses * Total loan capital and hybrid securities * Amounts payable to clients - outstanding security settlements, * Defined benefit liabilities - Current, Non-current, * Interest payable, * Unearned interest, * Derivative financial instruments, * Liabilities included in disposal groups classified as held for sale, * Share capital repayable on demand, * Items in suspense * Due to merchants
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Other Amount
This is a balancing item within the list in which it is being used
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Overdraft Amount
Any bank overdraft taken out by the insurer is to be disclosed along with any bank trading account credit balances.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Overseas Operations Total Liabilities Excluding Intra Company Transactions Amount
This data item includes all on balance sheet liabilities booked by the offshore operations with all counterparties.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Payable To Clients For Outstanding Security Settlements Amount

For those institutions that have broking activity with clients who are other than financial institutions, record the amount due to clients in relation to security settlement transactions. Do not include amounts payable to financial institutions or clearing houses in relation to security settlements.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Promissory Notes Commercial Paper Amount

Report all borrowings by the reporting entity in the form of commercial paper or promissory notes. Include: * all commercial paper or promissory notes issued with a residual term to maturity of 12 months or less. Commercial paper or promissory notes with a residual maturity greater than 12 months should be reported as "long-term debt".
Commercial paper or promissory notes are short-term debt securities usually issued with an original term to maturity of less than 180 days.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Secured Deposits Debt Securities And Loans From The Parent Entity Australian Sourced Amount

Report the total amount of liabilities of a secured nature from parties other than the parent, controlled or associated entities of the reporting entity. Liabilities in the form of deposits, loans, advances, bonds, notes and debentures should be reported.

A secured debt is a debt security that ranks above other debts should a company be wound up. This includes all debt securities both short and long-term. * A secured loan is a loan that ranks above other debts should a company be wound up.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Secured Deposits Debt Securities And Loans From The Parent Entity Amount

Report the total amount of liabilities of a secured nature from parties other than the parent, controlled or associated entities of the reporting entity. Liabilities in the form of deposits, loans, advances, bonds, notes and debentures should be reported.

A secured debt is a debt security that ranks above other debts should a company be wound up. This includes all debt securities both short and long-term. * A secured loan is a loan that ranks above other debts should a company be wound up.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Securities Purchased Not Delivered Security Settlements Amount
Record payables for unsettled purchases of securities. This item only arises if securities are recorded on a trade date basis as opposed to a settlement date basis.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Securities Sold Under Agreements To Repurchase Amount

These transactions are to be recorded consistently with AASB 139. Where the transferee of the stock effectively receives a lenders rate of return (i.e. the underlying risks and rewards of ownership of the underlying stock is not effectively transferred), these transactions are to be accounted for as collateralised lending activities (treating stock lending as on balance sheet exposures). Under this method of accounting the banks physical stock positions recorded on the balance sheet in either Trading Securities or Investment Securities sections is not affected.
Securities sold under agreements to repurchase, represents the payable due to counterparties with whom the stock has been lent and from whom cash has been lodged.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Share Capital Repayable On Demand Amount
Applicable to Credit Unions and Building Societies, this includes members' shares in co-operatives classified as liabilities consistent with AASB 132 and AASB 7.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Short Term Loans Fixed Amount
Report all borrowings by the reporting entity in the form of fixed interest rate short term loans. A loan is considered to be short term if its residual term to maturity is of 12 months or less.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Short Term Loans From ADIs Fixed Amount

Report all borrowings by the reporting entity in the form of fixed interest rate short-term loans from Australian ADIs/banks. A loan is considered to be short-term if its residual term to maturity is of 12 months or less. Settlement account balances due to other banks should be separately identified and reported as "Due to Financial Institutions: Banks".
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Short Term Loans From ADIs Variable Amount

Report all borrowings by the reporting entity in the form of variable interest rate short-term loans from ADIs/banks. A loan is considered to be short-term if its residual term to maturity is of 12 months or less. Settlement account balances due to other banks should be separately identified and reported as "Due to financial institutions: Banks".
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Short Term Loans From Other Short Term Debt Securities Amount

Report all borrowings by the reporting entity in the form of short-term debt securities, other than certificates of deposits and promissory notes/commercial paper (identified above). Include: * all debt securities issued with a residual term to maturity of 12 months or less. Other debt securities with a residual maturity greater than 12 months should be reported as "long-term debt".
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Short Term Loans From Other Than ADIs Fixed Amount

Report all borrowings by the reporting entity in the form of fixed interest rate short-term loans from counterparties other than banks and other ADIs. A loan is considered to be short-term if its residual term to maturity is of 12 months or less. Amounts due to clearing houses should be separately identified and reported as "Due to clearing houses". Settlement account balances should be separately identified and reported as "Due to financial institutions".
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Short Term Loans From Other Than ADIs Variable Amount

Report all borrowings by the reporting entity in the form of variable interest rate short-term loans from counterparties other than banks and other ADIs. A loan is considered to be short-term if its residual term to maturity is of 12 months or less. Amounts due to clearing houses should be separately identified and reported as "Due to clearing houses". Settlement account balances should be separately identified and reported as "Due to financial institutions.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Short Term Loans Variable Amount
Report all borrowings by the reporting entity in the form of variable interest rate short term loans. A loan is considered to be short term if its residual term to maturity is of 12 months or less.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Total Amount
For interpretation/definition of this item refer to the Australian Accounting Standards, as an example, see provided reference
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Trade Day Versus Settlement Adjustments Amount
Include: * any timing adjustments made to liability total for recording securities held on a settlement-day rather than trade-day basis.
Liabilities Other Financial Liabilities Unearned Interest Amount
Include interest received but not yet earned e.g. interest received in advance on fixed interest loan portfolio.
Liabilities Other Non Financial Liabilities Current Total Amount
For interpretation/definition of this item refer to the Australian Accounting Standards, as an example, see provided reference
Liabilities Other Non Financial Liabilities Non Current Total Amount
For interpretation/definition of this item refer to the Australian Accounting Standards, as an example, see provided reference
Liabilities Other Non Financial Liabilities Total Amount
This is the balancing item in the list in which it is used.
Liabilities Provisions Collective Provisions General Reserve For Credit Losses Amount

The General Reserve for Credit Losses reflects the intrinsic risk which might be calculated to exist in an entity's credit profile. For the purposes of Prudential Standard APS220, collective provisions raised by an ADI must be classified as either specific provisions or as part of the General Reserve for Credit Losses.
This item represents the total of collective provisions classified as General Reserve for Credit Losses.
Liabilities Provisions Collective Provisions Specific Provisions For Prudential Purposes Amount

In accordance with accounting standards, entities may assess provisions on an individual facility basis or on a collective basis. For the purposes of Prudential Standard APS220, collective provisions raised by an ADI must be classified as either specific provisions or as part of the General Reserve for Credit Losses.
This item represents the total of collective provisions classified as specific provisions.
Liabilities Provisions Collective Provisions Total Amount

In accordance with accounting standards, entities may assess provisions on an individual facility basis or on a collective basis. The General Reserve for Credit Losses reflects the intrinsic risk which might be calculated to exist in an entity's credit profile. For the purposes of Prudential Standard APS220, collective provisions raised by an ADI must be classified as either specific provisions or as part of the General Reserve for Credit Losses.
This item represents the total of collective provisions regardless of their classification as specific provisions or General Reserve for Credit Losses.
Liabilities Provisions Current Dividends Amount
A provision for dividends is the allowance that the reporting entity has made in terms of the obligation for declared dividends that are expected to be paid within the next 12 months.
Liabilities Provisions Current Employee Entitlements Amount

This includes provisions for long service leave, annual leave, staff housing loan benefits, health fund subsidy and other employee entitlements that are due and payable within the next 12 months. The value of employee entitlements should be measured and recognised in accordance with the requirements of AASB 119 'Employee Benefits'.
Liabilities Provisions Current Other Amount
This is a balancing item within the list in which it is being used
Liabilities Provisions Current Restructuring Costs Amount

Report all provisions raised for the restructuring of an organisation that are due and payable within the next 12 months, including: * Severance, termination and redundancy payments; and * Integration cost.
Liabilities Provisions Current Total Amount
This is the total of all provisions expected to be paid or realised within the next 12 months.
Liabilities Provisions Disclosure Text
For interpretation/definition of this item refer to the Australian Accounting Standards, as an example, see provided reference
Liabilities Provisions Dividends Amount
A provision for dividends is the allowance that the reporting entity has made in terms of the obligation for declared dividends.
Liabilities Provisions Employee Entitlements Amount

Include: * provisions for long service leave, annual leave, staff housing loan benefits, health fund subsidy and other employee entitlements. This should be reported in accordance with the requirements of AASB 119.
For interpretation/definition of this item refer to the Australian Accounting Standards, as an example, see provided reference
Liabilities Provisions General Reserve For Credit Losses For Prudential Purposes Amount

The General Reserve for Credit Losses reflects the intrinsic risk which might be calculated to exist in an entity's credit profile. For the purposes of Prudential Standard APS220, collective provisions raised by an ADI must be classified as either specific provisions or as part of the General Reserve for Credit Losses.
This item represents the total of General Reserve for Credit Losses NOT classified as collective provisions.
Liabilities Provisions General Reserve For Credit Losses Total Amount
The General Reserve for Credit Losses reflects the intrinsic risk which might be calculated to exist in an entity's credit profile.
Liabilities Provisions IFRS Specific Provisions Total Amount
IFRS Specific provisions represent identified or estimated losses on individual facilities measured and disclosed in accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards
Liabilities Provisions Loan Loss Provisions Total Amount

The total of: - In accordance with accounting standards, entities may assess provisions on an individual facility basis or on a collective basis. This item is the total of the provisions assessed under either method. - The General Reserve for Credit Losses reflects the intrinsic risk which might be calculated to exist in an entity's credit profile.
Liabilities Provisions Mortgage Insurance Claims And Unearned Premium Amount
Include: * provision for Mortgage insurance claims and unearned premium
Liabilities Provisions Non Current Dividends Amount
A non current provision for dividends is the allowance that the reporting entity has made in terms of the obligation for declared dividends that are expected to be paid beyond the next 12 months.
Liabilities Provisions Non Current Employee Entitlements Amount

This includes provisions for long service leave, annual leave, staff housing loan benefits, health fund subsidy and other employee entitlements that are not due and payable within the next 12 months. The value of employee entitlements should be measured and recognised in accordance with the requirements of AASB 119 'Employee Benefits'.
Liabilities Provisions Non Current Other Amount
This is a balancing item within the list in which it is being used
Liabilities Provisions Non Current Restructuring Costs Amount

Report all provisions raised for the restructuring of an organisation that are not due and payable within the next 12 months, including: * Severance, termination and redundancy payments; and * Integration cost.
Liabilities Provisions Non Current Total Amount
This is the total of all provisions expected to be paid or realised beyond the next 12 months.
Liabilities Provisions Non-Lending Losses Amount
Liabilities Provisions Other Amount

Report all other provisions not identified above. Include: * specific provision for off-balance sheet credit related commitments; * leased premises surplus to current requirements; and * provision for subsidiary integration costs.
Liabilities Provisions Restructuring Costs Amount
Report all provisions raised for the restructuring of an organization. Include: * severance, termination and redundancy payments; and * integration costs.
Liabilities Provisions Reversals Of Provisions Other Amount
For interpretation/definition of this item refer to the Australian Accounting Standards, as an example, see provided reference
Liabilities Provisions Specific Provisions For Prudential Purposes Total Amount

In accordance with accounting standards, entities may assess provisions on an individual facility basis or on a collective basis. This item is the total of the provisions assessed under either method.
Liabilities Provisions Total Amount
Sum all the "Provisions" reporting items.
Total of all provisions calculated in accordance with Australian Accounting Standards
Liabilities Related Parties Current Creditors And Accruals Amount
Include the total of creditors and accruals, including account payables that are payable to related parties and due within 12 months. Do not include overdrafts or GST liability.
Related party has the meaning as set out in AASB 124
Liabilities Related Parties Current Deposits Debt Securities And Loans From Controlled Entities Total Amount
Of the total amount reported for Borrowings identify the component that is payable to controlled entities of the parent insurer within the next 12 months.
Liabilities Related Parties Current Deposits Debt Securities And Loans From Other Related Entities Total Amount
Of the total amount reported for Borrowings identify the component that is payable to other related entities and are due within the next 12 months.
Related party has the meaning as set out in AASB 124
Liabilities Related Parties Current Deposits Debt Securities And Loans From Parent Entity Total Amount
Of the total amount reported for Borrowings identify the component that is payable or due to the Parent Entity of the insurer within the next 12 months.
Liabilities Related Parties Deposits Debt Securities And Loans From Controlled Entities And Associates Australian Sourced Total Amount

Report the total amount of Australian sourced deposits, debt securities and loans from controlled entities or associates of the reporting entity. Liabilities in the form of deposits, loans, advances, bonds, notes and debentures should be reported. Amounts reported are irrespective of the repayment term - i.e. the total of current and non current liabilities for this item.
Liabilities Related Parties Deposits Debt Securities And Loans From Parent Entity Total Amount

Report the total amount of deposits, debt securities and loans from the parent entity. Liabilities in the form of deposits, loans, advances, bonds, notes and debentures should be reported. Amounts reported are irrespective of the repayment term - i.e. the total of current and non current liabilities for this item.
Liabilities Related Parties Deposits Debt Securities And Loans From The Parent Entity Australian Sourced Total Amount

Report the total amount of Australian sourced deposits, debt securities and loans from the parent entity. Liabilities in the form of deposits, loans, advances, bonds, notes and debentures should be reported.
Liabilities Related Parties Deposits Amount
Report deposits from related parties. Exclude: * debt securities issued to related parties; and * other accounts payable (e.g. fees and commissions payable) from related parties.
Liabilities Related Parties Intra Company Borrowings Amount
Report borrowings from other offices within the ADI (including the head office).
Liabilities Related Parties Liabilities Due From Associated Entities Or Joint Ventures Australian Sourced Amount
Liabilities due to associated entities or joint ventures defined in accordance with Australian Accounting Standards.
Liabilities Related Parties Loan Capital And Hybrid Securities Payable To Controlled Entities Amount

Report the face value of all loan capital and hybrid securities that have a residual term to maturity of more than one year and are payable or due to Controlled entities of the Parent Entity(s) of the insurer. Classification is to be consistent with AASB 132 and AASB 7. As a guide include: * Members withdrawable shares; * preference shares; * convertible notes; and * subordinated loans of a residual maturity of more than one year.
Liabilities Related Parties Loan Capital And Hybrid Securities Payable To Other Related Entities Amount

Report the face value of all loan capital and hybrid securities that have a residual term to maturity of more than one year and are payable or due to related entities that are not the Parent entity nor Controlled entities of the Parent Entity(s) of the insurer. Classification is to be consistent with AASB 132 and AASB 7. As a guide include: * Members withdrawable shares; * preference shares; * convertible notes; and * subordinated loans of a residual maturity of more than one year.
Liabilities Related Parties Loan Capital And Hybrid Securities Payable To Parent Entity Amount

Report the face value of all loan capital and hybrid securities that have a residual term to maturity of more than one year and are payable or due to the Parent Entity(s) of the insurer. Classification is to be consistent with AASB 132 and AASB 7. As a guide include: * Members withdrawable shares; * preference shares; * convertible notes; and * subordinated loans of a residual maturity of more than one year.
Liabilities Related Parties Non Current Creditors And Accruals Amount
Include the total of creditors and accruals, including account payables that are payable to related parties and not due within 12 months. Do not include overdrafts or GST liability.
Liabilities Related Parties Non Current Deposits Debt Securities And Loans From Controlled Entities Total Amount
Of the total amount reported for Borrowings identify the component that is payable to controlled entities of the parent insurer beyond the next 12 months.
Liabilities Related Parties Non Current Deposits Debt Securities And Loans From Other Related Entities Total Amount
Of the total amount reported for Borrowings identify the component that is payable to other related entities and are not due within the next 12 months.
Liabilities Related Parties Non Current Deposits Debt Securities And Loans From Parent Entity Total Amount
Of the total amount reported for Borrowings identify the component that is payable or due to the Parent Entity of the insurer beyond the next 12 months.
Liabilities Related Parties Other Deposits Debt Securities And Loans From Controlled Entities And Associates Australian Sourced Amount

Report the total amount of liabilities other than subordinated or secured in nature, from controlled entities or associates of the reporting entity. Liabilities in the form of deposits, loans, advances, bonds, notes and debentures should be reported.
Liabilities Related Parties Other Deposits Debt Securities And Loans From Controlled Entities And Associates Amount

Report the total amount of liabilities other than subordinated or secured in nature, from controlled entities or associates of the reporting entity. Liabilities in the form of deposits, loans, advances, bonds, notes and debentures should be reported.
Liabilities Related Parties Other Deposits Debt Securities And Loans From The Parent Entity Australian Sourced Amount

Report the total amount of liabilities other than subordinated or secured in nature, from the parent entity of the reporting entity. Liabilities in the form of deposits, loans, advances, bonds, notes and debentures should be reported.
Liabilities Related Parties Other Deposits Debt Securities And Loans From The Parent Entity Amount

Report the total amount of liabilities other than subordinated or secured in nature, from the parent entity of the reporting entity. Liabilities in the form of deposits, loans, advances, bonds, notes and debentures should be reported.
Liabilities Related Parties Secured Deposits Debt Securities And Loans From Controlled Entities And Associates Australian Sourced Amount

Report the total amount of liabilities of a secured nature from controlled entities or associates of the reporting entity. Liabilities in the form of deposits, loans, advances, bonds, notes and debentures should be reported.

A secured debt is a debt security that ranks above other debts should a company be wound up. This includes all debt securities both short and long-term. * A secured loan is a loan that ranks above other debts should a company be wound up.
Liabilities Related Parties Secured Deposits Debt Securities And Loans From Controlled Entities And Associates Amount

Report the total amount of liabilities of a secured nature from controlled entities or associates of the reporting entity. Liabilities in the form of deposits, loans, advances, bonds, notes and debentures should be reported.

A secured debt is a debt security that ranks above other debts should a company be wound up. This includes all debt securities both short and long-term. * A secured loan is a loan that ranks above other debts should a company be wound up.
Liabilities Related Parties Secured Deposits Debt Securities And Loans From The Parent Entity Australian Sourced Amount

Report the total amount of liabilities of a secured nature from controlled entities or associates of the reporting entity. Liabilities in the form of deposits, loans, advances, bonds, notes and debentures should be reported.

A secured debt is a debt security that ranks above other debts should a company be wound up. This includes all debt securities both short and long-term. * A secured loan is a loan that ranks above other debts should a company be wound up.
Liabilities Related Parties Secured Loan Capital And Hybrid Securities Amount

Report the face value of all loan capital and hybrid securities that have a residual term to maturity of more than one year and are secured against the assets of the insurer. Classification is to be consistent with AASB 132 and AASB 7. As a guide include: * Members withdrawable shares; * preference shares; * convertible notes; and * subordinated loans of a residual maturity of more than one year.
Liabilities Related Parties Subordinated Deposits Debt Securities And Loans From Controlled Entities And Associates Australian Sourced Amount

Report the total amount of liabilities of a subordinated nature from controlled entities or associates of the reporting entity. Liabilities in the form of deposits, loans, advances, bonds, notes and debentures should be reported.

A subordinated debt is a debt security that ranks below other debts should a company be wound up. This includes all debt securities both short and long-term. * A subordinated loan is a loan that ranks below other debts should a company be wound up.
Liabilities Related Parties Subordinated Deposits Debt Securities And Loans From Controlled Entities And Associates Amount

Report the total amount of liabilities of a subordinated nature from controlled entities or associates of the reporting entity. Liabilities in the form of deposits, loans, advances, bonds, notes and debentures should be reported.

A subordinated debt is a debt security that ranks below other debts should a company be wound up. This includes all debt securities both short and long-term. * A subordinated loan is a loan that ranks below other debts should a company be wound up.
Liabilities Related Parties Subordinated Deposits Debt Securities And Loans From The Parent Entity Australian Sourced Amount

Report the total amount of liabilities of a subordinated nature from the parent entity of the reporting entity. Liabilities in the form of deposits, loans, advances, bonds, notes and debentures should be reported.

A subordinated debt is a debt security that ranks below other debts should a company be wound up. This includes all debt securities both short and long-term. * A subordinated loan is a loan that ranks below other debts should a company be wound up.
Liabilities Related Parties Subordinated Deposits Debt Securities And Loans From The Parent Entity Amount

Report the total amount of liabilities of a subordinated nature from the parent entity of the reporting entity. Liabilities in the form of deposits, loans, advances, bonds, notes and debentures should be reported.

A subordinated debt is a debt security that ranks below other debts should a company be wound up. This includes all debt securities both short and long-term. * A subordinated loan is a loan that ranks below other debts should a company be wound up.
